intro: Karwinskia mollis, commonly known as the Mexican white oak, is a deciduous tree native to central Mexico. It belongs to the beech family (Fagaceae) and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and broad, lobed leaves. The tree produces small, cup-shaped acorns that are an important food source for wildlife. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open woodlands. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
